dcterms:description: The Gab Hate Corpus (GHC) comprises 27,665 social media posts from Gab.com annotated by a minimum of three annotators. The GHC features an extensive coding framework that encompasses hierarchical labels denoting dehumanizing and violent speech, markers indicating targeted groups, and rhetorical framing.
dcterms:title: Gab Hate Speech Corpus

dcterms:creator: Dorottya Demszky
Dana Movshovitz-Attias
Jeongwoo Ko
Alan Cowen
Gaurav Nemade
Sujith Ravi
dcterms:description: The GoEmotions dataset has fine-grained emotions comprising 58k English Reddit comments and labeled for 27 emotion categories and a neutral label for no emotion. The focus is on six Ekman emotions from the experiments of Davani et al. (2022).
dcterms:title: GoEmotions

dcterms:creator: Sohail Akhtar
Valerio Basile
Viviana Patti
dcterms:description: The Hate Speech Brexit (HSB) dataset consists of 1,120 tweets related to Brexit and immigration, annotated for hate speech, aggressiveness, and offensiveness by two distinct groups of three annotators.
dcterms:title: HS-Brexit

dcterms:creator: Amanda Cercas Curry
Gavin Abercrombie
Verena Rieser
dcterms:description: The Conversational Abuse (CVA) dataset contains approximately 4k English dialogues between users and two conversational agents, annotated by at least three experts in gender studies using a hierarchical labeling scheme.
dcterms:title: ConvAbuse

dcterms:creator: Elisa Leonardelli
Stefano Menini
Alessio Palmero Aprosio
Marco Guerini
Sara Tonelli
dcterms:description: The Multi-Domain Agreement dataset comprises 10,753 tweets from three domains: Black Lives Matter, 2020 USA Presidential Elections, and COVID-19, annotated for offensiveness by a group of five annotators.
dcterms:title: Multi-Domain Agreement

dcterms:creator: Dina Almanea
Massimo Poesio
dcterms:description: The Arabic Misogyny and Sexism (ArMIS) dataset contains over 900 Arabic tweets annotated specifically for the detection of misogyny and sexism, focusing on varying perspectives of the annotators.
dcterms:title: ArMIS

dcterms:creator: Maxwell Forbes
Jena D. Hwang
Vered Shwartz
Maarten Sap
Yejin Choi
dcterms:description: The Social Chemistry dataset is sourced from Reddit, specifically utilizing posts and comments from the /r/amitheasshole subreddit where users share social experiences and seek community opinions on behavior appropriateness.
dcterms:title: Social Chemistry
